info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 5:43PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Berks, southern Lehigh and southwestern Northampton Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 543 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Emmaus, or near Allentown, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Allentown, Bethlehem, Emmaus, Northampton, Topton, Steuben, Coffeetown, Zionsville, Ancient Oaks, Lehigh University, Claussville, Catasauqua, Fountain Hill, Coplay, Macungie, North Catasauqua, Coopersburg, Alburtis, Fullerton and Hokendauqua. This includes the following highways... Northeast Extension between mile markers 46 and 61. Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 43 and 65. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for eastern and southeastern Pennsylvania.
